definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: According to Zhao, life in military campsites is not monotonous.
sentences.chinese: 趙峯表示，軍營生活並不單調。

sentences.english: In the barracks, men always outnumbered women.
Their colleagues in an army battalion stationed in Wuchang mutinied.
sentences.chinese: 他們在武漢軍營中共事的同事發動了這次叛變。

sentences.english: A mustering hall allows troops to be selected and trained to a basic standard.
sentences.chinese: 城寨軍營對軍隊進行基本戰術訓練。

sentences.english: Jack and Harry bunked together at camp.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和哈里在軍營裏合鋪。

sentences.english: That Manlian camp of yours has been waiting too long for you as its general.
sentences.chinese: 你們的曼利安軍營等待你當他們的主帥已久。

sentences.english: Deraa national hospital has become a military barracks that's being occupied by the army.
sentences.chinese: 德拉國立醫院已經被軍隊佔領，成爲一座軍營。

sentences.english: Every day Goliath came near Saul's camp.
sentences.chinese: 每天戈利亞斯都到薩奧的軍營附近。

sentences.english: Kay power will enjoy cadets back to barracks.
sentences.chinese: 凱權將玩的盡興的新兵們帶回軍營。

sentences.english: The remainder of the troops were confined to their barracks, without reckoning the regiments of the environs of Paris.
sentences.chinese: 其餘的軍隊在軍營裏，巴黎四周的聯隊還沒計算在內。
米甸人的軍營一篇驚慌混亂。

sentences.english: He bolted for the camp exits.
Barracks house recruits and garrison troops in some small comfort, but then the life of soldier is supposed to be hard.
sentences.chinese: 堡壘軍營的生活較爲舒適，但戍衛生涯依然枯燥如舊。

sentences.english: Night getting deeper, bugles of some far-away barracks streaked across the sky.
sentences.chinese: 夜漸漸深了，天空劃過遠處軍營傳來的熄燈號聲。

sentences.english: In the blistering sun they stood patiently, like a small battalion.
sentences.chinese: 驕陽下他們耐心地站着，象一個小軍營。

sentences.english: The army fought its way down and captured many enemy camps.
sentences.chinese: 這支部隊長驅直入，攻下了許多敵軍軍營。

definition: to serve in the army/to be a soldier
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
